result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] and Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer]. The defendant was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] was dismissed by the court.

  • Heather L. Waller was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Arresting Agency: WTPD

  Defendant is required to report for commencement and service of jail sentence with absolute sobriety and without non-prescribed controlled substances in his/her system.  Non-compliance will result in loss of Huber/work-release privileges without further process.

  If probation, parole or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of the victim(s) and government entities for the balance due.

Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: with Elements and Criminal Case Settlement attached

Case called at 11:32 am [Clerk SH] (Case was scheduled for FSSC)
Defendant Heather L. Waller in court with Attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa. ADA Theresa A Beck appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Victim RIghts Compliance Verified; Court so finds

Constitutional rights reviewed; maximum penalties recited; plea of "Guilty" entered on Count #1; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; Court finds the plea has been entered freely, voluntarily, intelligently and accepts the plea, finds the Defendant  guilty, and orders JOC entered.
On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Count #2, jeopardy attaches and further prosecution is barred

The Court adopts the parties recommendation, which includes:

On Count #1, the Court sentences Mrs. Waller to 4 years, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison 2 years and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 2 years. This sentence is IMPOSED & STAYED and the Court places Mrs. Waller on Probation for 3 years with conditions: 
--serve 160 days in Jefferson County Jail, with Huber/Work-release privileges; to commence  forthwith, followed immediately by 120 days on SCRAM X ("good time" credit to be applied to both components of order). Release shall be allowed for AA and/or NA meetings.
--Absolute sobriety (no possession or consumption of alcohol, no possession of controlled substances w/o a valid prescription, take all prescription drugs as prescribed)
--No presence in bars, taverns or liquor stores
--No operation of a motor vehicle without a valid Drivers License and Agent Approval
--Pay all fines, costs and fees including subpeona fees incurred by the State
--Any assessment, treatment or counseling required by the Agent
--The Defendant shall not possess or consume any non-prescribed controlled substances
--Pay fine of $6000 plus costs
--DNA Sample and Surcharge

Other Sentence:
--Revocation of Operating Privileges: 36 months
--6 demerit points
--AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment per Agent
--Attendance at a Victim Impact Panel - Any County (amended by the Court for attendance in any county)
--Ignition Interlock Device Requirement/restriction pursuant to 343.301(1g) for: 36 months

The Court finds that the Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program (Boot Camp) and the Substance Abuse Program. 
The Court gives 1 day credit for time already served

Felony Firearm and Voting-rights prohibitions/warnings given
Explanation of Determinate Sentence form given to the Defendant
Court orders Sheriff's Office to collect DNA Sample
Recess: 11:50 am
Sent to Defendant (1)NOH for 2/1/2016 FSSC (2)NOH for 2/4/16 Jury Trial//sent to LKA

Case called at 9:05am [mo]
Defendant Heather L. Waller in court with Attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa.   ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Shock verifies victim rights compliance

Atty. De La Rosa indicates that resolution has not been met, requests an additional 3 weeks to allow discussion with the prosecutor.
recess:9:08am--reconvene:9:21am [to allow ADA Shock to retrieve lab analyst availability]
The Court schedules this case for FSSC and Jury Trial
The Court and Counsel discuss scheduling; ADA Shock indicates that the lab analyst is available on the dates chosen for the Jury Trial.
The Court distributes its scheduling order 
recess: 9:25am

NEXT: (1)FSSC on 2/1/2016 at 11:00am (2) Jury Trial on 2/4 or 25/2016 at 8:30am

DA Happ verifies victim rights compliance
Atty. Svehlek requests that this case be scheduled for Preliminary Hearing

Case called at 1:30 pm [sf]
Defendant Heather L. Waller in custody, via video from the Jefferson County Jail with Attorney Jeffrey De La Rosa from the Jefferson County Public Defenders Office. Public Service Special Prosecutor Melanie Flint appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Attorney De La Rosa advises that the Defendant qualifies for SPD.
Upon stipulation, the Court finds the video connection to be sight and sound sufficient. 
Address and DOB information verified.
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, maximum penalties recited
Bail/Bond recommendations presented by counsel.

Court requires $10,000.00 signature bond, with conditions: 
-No possession or consumption of alcohol 
-No possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid   
  prescription
-No possession of drug paraphernalia without a valid prescription to include syringes
-Not to drive a motor vehicle
-The Defendant is to report and comply with SCRAM alcohol monitoring program as administered by Wisconsin Community Services.  The Court orders the defendant to SCRAM monitoring through WCS, with the consideration of Remote Breath as an alternative only when WCS verifies that a defendant's work environment or health condition prohibits the SCRAM bracelet. The Defendant is to comply with all SCRAM Program conditions of participation including payment of program costs and fees.  The Defendant is to report for SCRAM installation in Room 230 of the Jefferson County Courthouse on today 6/15/15 if defendant is signing bond.  **If in custody, release on SCRAM only.**

Preliminary Hearing time limits waived by both parties.

Recess: 1:36 pm
NEXT: (Notices to be mailed)
PTC: 7/15/15 at 10:00 am
Status: 8/18/15 at 8:30 am
